New Records: Lautaro Martínez scored the winning goal for Argentina in the 112th minute of the final, breaking the tie and securing the victory
Key Match Events: Argentina won the match in extra time with a 1-0 scoreline
Lautaro Martínez scored the goal at the 112th minute
Key substitutions by both teams during the game
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina was favored with a +115 odds to win
Both teams had specific formations: Argentina used a 4-3-3 and Colombia a 4-2-3-1
Key players mentioned included Lautaro Martínez, Giovani Lo Celso, and James Rodríguez
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi left the game with an injury
Argentina secured their record-extending 16th Copa América title
The match was marred by crowd control issues
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, USA
The game was delayed slightly due to fans rushing gates
